definition: to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
somniloquy/to talk or act in one's sleep/sleep-walking

sentences.english: This habit also robbed me of a chance of making easy money.
sentences.chinese: 嚴守時刻的習慣還剝奪我掙容易錢的機會。

sentences.english: I was earning extra money writing articles and book reviews.
sentences.chinese: 我寫文章和書評掙額外的錢。

sentences.english: My classmate has made lots of money since he quit his job and ventured into business last year.
sentences.chinese: 我同學去年辭職下海經商後掙了大錢。

sentences.english: He drew as much as two thousand francs a year from it; this constituted nearly the whole of his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他因而每年能掙兩千法郎，這便是他的全部家產了。

sentences.english: The breadwinner had been taken away from them; what would they do?
sentences.chinese: 爲他們一家掙麪包的老馬沒有了，他們怎麼辦呢？

sentences.english: Why does the average actress get less than the average actor?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼一般女演員掙的錢比一般男演員要少？

sentences.english: Chen Chen said, benefit also assembles, for a car to earn one thousand or two thousand.
sentences.chinese: 陳晨說，效益還湊合，辦理一輛車掙一兩千。

sentences.english: The phrase earning a degree" summarizes the evils of extrinsically oriented education."
sentences.chinese: 常用短語掙一個學位總結出重在表面上的教育的弊端。

sentences.english: And how much do you earn?
sentences.chinese: 然後還有你掙多少，等等。

sentences.english: How much time do I need to work for this item?
sentences.chinese: 我需要工作多長時間，才能掙夠買它的錢？

sentences.english: He has spent all his earnings.
I graduated from a backwater college last year and I make about 2500 dollars every month.
sentences.chinese: 去年從那後水大學畢業後，我每月掙2500美元。

sentences.english: what good that's going to be, no matter how much money you make.
sentences.chinese: 什麼好處也沒有，掙多少錢都沒用。

sentences.english: I know I've made some money, but it was no cinch to get it.
sentences.chinese: 我是掙了錢，但這錢掙的太不容易了。

sentences.english: I often hear of complains made by husbands that thire wives spend more money than they earn.
sentences.chinese: 我經常聽到丈夫們抱怨妻子花錢比他們掙的多。

definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
to live one's life/to make a living
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
